citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Public Land Surveys, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Public Land Surveys is a polygon theme representing the Public Land Surveys (for example, donation lands, land grants, and public and private surveys of public lands) of the United States. Attribute information includes the survey area type, the township and range designation for the area, the name, state , township, range and size of the area.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Public Land Surveys provides the Public Land Surveys for geographic display and analysis at regional and national levels.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:

Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.706

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from 1:500,000 and 1:1,000,000-scale state base maps for the western U.S. states and USGS topographic 1:100,000-scale maps for the eastern U.S. states. Data from both sources were integrated into the 1:2,000,000-scale State boundary Digital Line Graph (DLG) files produced by the U.S. Geological Survey. The positional accuracy of the 1:2,000,000-scale State boundary Digital Line Graph (DLG) files is known to be 1,720 meters. The positional accuracies of the other sources are unknown.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Public Land Survey System of the United States, 2008
citeinfo.othercit: The data set was downloaded from the web site in November 2004.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded plss00p020.tar.gz from the National Atlas of the United States web site and extracted the shapefile. Added attributes TOWNSHIP, RANGE, and TWNRNG and created their values from parsing the values of the FEATURE2 attribute. Reduced the attribute widths of FEATURE1, FEATURE2, FEATURE3, NAME1, NAME2, and STATE. Renamed attribute AREA to SQMI and calculated its values. Removed unneeded attributes. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the Public Land Survey which is a rectangular system of surveys devised to subdivide public domain lands within United States; in addition are donation land claims, Indian lands, land grants, civil colonies, military reservations, overlapping land grants, private surveys, unsurveyed areas, and areas not part of the Public Land Survey System within United States.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area that was allocated to a settler under the Donation Act of September 27, 1850 to preserve the rights of pre-statehood settlers claimed prior to the regular division of townships and ranges.
Land granted to native Americans and excluded from the public domain.
An area of land to which title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States.
A military or lighthouse reservation that limits the public lands.

edom.edomv: Not Part of Public Land Surveys System
edom.edomvd: An area that is outside of the Public Land Survey System.

An area of land to which more than one title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States. These areas are the result of survey error or disputed claims.
An area of private surveys of public domain lands.

An area of land subdivided by the Public Land Survey System (PLSS), which was originally created on public domain lands and the rules for its use were defined by the authority of the U.S. Government. The PLSS has since been extended, following similar rules, into non- public domain areas.
An area that is part of the public domain but which has not been subdivided.
Areas of navigable streams and meanderable lakes which are excluded from the Public Land Survey System.

attr.attrdef: The township and range designation for the area.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: There is no predefined set of valid township and range designations. Designations are in the format "Township xxx aaaaa Range yyy bbbb", where xxx and yyy are numbers, aaaaa is either North or South, and bbbb is either East or West.

attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area of land to which title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States.

An area of land to which more than one title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States. These areas are the result of survey error or disputed claims.

attr.attrdef: The primary name of the survey area. This is the principal meridian, Ohio base, or land grant name.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The secondary name of the survey area. This is an additional land grant name.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for each state in which the survey area is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The abbreviated township designation for the area.

attrdomv.udom: Designations are in the format "Txxxa", where xxx is a number and a is either N or S.

attr.attrdef: The abbreviated range designation for the area.

attrdomv.udom: Designations are in the format "Ryyyb", where yyy is a number and b is either E or W.

attr.attrdef: The abbreviated township and range designation for the area.

attrdomv.udom: Designations are in the format "Txxxa Ryyyb", where xxx and yyy are numbers, a is either N or S, and b is either E or W.

attr.attrdef: The area of the survey area in square miles.
